result.markdown:
---
title: "Chart: Over 13 years, basic police pay has fallen by 22% in real terms"
author: Matt Ashby
date: '2022-07-19'
slug: police-pay-2022
categories: ["Crime and justice chart of the week"]
tags:
  - criminal justice
  - police
---

















A combination of government-led changes to pay mean a police constable who has just completed initial training in England and Wales in 2022 is paid about Â£7,600 less now than they would have been in 2010, once inflation is taken into account. These figures exclude overtime and special allowances, but those are unlikely to have made up for decreasing basic pay.



::: {.cell}

:::



[larger image](../police-pay-2022.png)
| [annotated R code to produce this chart](https://github.com/mpjashby/lesscrime.info/blob/master/content/post/police-pay-2022.Rmd)

Data source: [Police Federation, Home Office](https://www.whatdotheyknow.com/request/police_constable_pay_scales)

Pay for years before 2022 has been adjusted for inflation using the [Office for
National Statistics preferred CPIH measure](https://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/inflationandpriceindices/timeseries/l522/mm23).
For 2022, the inflation estimate for May (the latest available) has been used.
